com.uttt.common.board

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.uttt.common.board.Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Node, Playable

    public final class Board
extends java.lang.Object
implements Node, Playable
    A board repesents an independent field of play, where that field is (A) square, and (B) where each position in that field is either a token-spot, or itself a (subordinate) board. This creates a recursive parent<-*>child relationship, with tokens at the base (the final child-level).

    Further, some invariants are guaranteed for all valid boards:

    • All boards reachable through this relationship must have the same (square) field size.
    • Within each board field, all positions are either all Token values, or are all Board instances of mutually equal height.

      • isPlayable

        public boolean isPlayable()
        Description copied from interface: Playable
        Return true iff the associated Position refers to an open token spot, or an open board. A board, in turn, is open iff no win has been acheived at its own field level and there is at least one (resursively) open position in its field.
        Specified by:
        isPlayable in interface Playable

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Return true iff value-wise equal. NOTE: The position of the boards within their parents is NOT considered part of the equality test, although any sub-boards of the two boards under comparison are compared in a same-position manner. Essentially, this means that the equality test is only sensitive to the Token layout of the bottom boards.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
